entry.title: Pete Sutherland (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Vermont folk musician Pete Sutherland (pictured) hosted concerts at his house for $10—or $9 if you brought your own chair?

entry.title: Jikandia: The Timeless Land (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the developers of Jikandia: The Timeless Land wanted to make a game that could be finished in the time of a normal Japanese train commute?

entry.title: Del Riley (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Linn County clerk Del Riley established Oregon's vote-by-mail system, now used as the only voting method in the state?

entry.title: Pinky & Pepper Forever (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Pinky & Pepper Forever is a graphic novel that follows two anthropomorphic dog girlfriends through hell?

entry.title: Battle of Bronkhorstspruit (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that within 15 minutes of the Battle of Bronkhorstspruit, all the British officers in the battle were either killed or seriously wounded?

entry.title: common prosperity (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Chinese leader Xi Jinping called common prosperity an essential requirement of socialism but also said that it does not represent uniform egalitarianism?

entry.title: David DeJulius (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in 2022 David DeJulius pledged to donate his student athlete compensation from jersey proceeds to provide books to inner city youth?

entry.title: Parkville (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Parkville lost out on becoming the Colorado Territory's capital by eleven votes and is now a ghost town largely buried under mining waste?
